workflow.name: Nightly n8n backup to Google Drive
workflow.description:
## Description

This template creates a nightly backup of all n8n workflows and saves them to a Google Drive folder. Each night, the previous night's backups are moved to an ‚Äún8n_old‚Äù folder and renamed with the corresponding date.

Backups older than a specified age are automatically deleted using a precise code-based verification (this feature is active for 30 days by default, but is fully configurable).

## What's New in v5

* **Modernized Loops:** Replaced the legacy "Split In Batches" node with the newer and more efficient **"Loop Over Items"** node.
* **Smart Purge Logic:** Now uses a **Code node** with Javascript (`you can delete`) to accurately calculate file age before deletion, ensuring only files strictly older than 30 days are removed.
* **Safety Checks:** Implemented logic to verify if the "n8n_old" folder exists before attempting any purge operations to prevent errors.
* **Auto-Healing:** The system now automatically creates the `n8n_backups` and `n8n_old` folders if they are missing.

## Prerequisites

* **Google Drive account and credentials:** **Get** from the following link. [Link](https://console.cloud.google.com/apis/credentials/oauthclient/)
* **n8n version:** Recommended v1.70.1 up to v2.1.4 or higher (Required for "Loop Over Items" compatibility).
* **n8n API Key:** **Guide** from the following link. [Link](https://witmovil.com/where-to-create-the-api-key-in-n8n/) (Required for the "Get many workflows" node).
* **Destination folders** (Optional, as the script can now create them, but good to have):
* ‚Äún8n_old‚Äù
* ‚Äún8n_backups‚Äù

## Configuration

1. **Google Drive:** Update all Google Drive nodes with your OAuth2 credentials.
2. **n8n Connection:** Open the "Get many workflows" node (formerly just "n8n") and select your **n8n account** credential (API Key).
3. **Schedule:** Edit the Schedule Trigger node with the desired time to run the backup.

**If you want to configure the auto-purge (delete old backups):**

1. The deletion logic is now handled in the **"you can delete"** Code node. You can edit the variable `const THIRTY_DAYS_IN_MS` in the code if you wish to change the 30-day limit.
2. Enable the ‚ÄúPURGE DAYS‚Äù trigger and the subsequent nodes to activate this feature.
3. Enable the workflow to run on the specified schedule.

## Last updated

December 2025

parameters.content:
MOVE CURRENT BACKUPS TO OLD FOLDER

* GET CURRENT BACKUPS: Retrieves a list of current backups in the n8n_backups folder.
* Loop Over Items: Iterates over files and moves them to the n8n_old folder.
* MOVE INTO OLD FOLDER: Moves files from the current backups folder to the old backups folder (n8n_old).

PURGE BACKUPS OLDER THEN 30 DAYS
Identifies backups that are more than 30 days old and deletes them (code).

## Ignore any other folders other than: n8n_backups



(it is important that you created this folder)
### Since the n8n backups and n8n old folders are missing, they are created automatically.
### The system automatically creates the folders n8n_backups and n8n_old if they do not already exist.

### Bug Fixes & Improvements v5
* **Purge Folder Verification:** Fixed the way files are retrieved from the purge folder. Now, it first checks if the folder exists before attempting to delete it.
> *Please ensure that only one folder with the name `n8n_old` exists.*


* **Smart Date Filtering:** Updated file filtering in the purge process to delete **only files older than 30 days**. This functionality is configurable via the **Code** node and can be removed if you prefer the schedule to run and delete everything regardless of file age.
* **Modernized Loops:** In this new version, the legacy "Split In Batches" node has been replaced with the modern **"Loop Over Items"** node.
* **Localization:** Added a documentation section in Spanish.
* **Enhanced Targeting:** Implemented a "Get Current Folder" node to strictly filter files by folder during the purge process.

BACKUP ALL CURRENT WORKFLOWS limit 100 (Change)

* Move Binary Data: Converts data to JSON format for processing.
* UPLOAD WORKFLOWS: Uploads up to 100 workflows to storage as a backup.
Combines detected folder lists for processing.

### Description
This template creates a nightly backup of all n8n workflows and saves them to a **Google Drive** folder. Each night, the previous night's backups are moved to an ‚Äún8n_old‚Äù folder and renamed with the corresponding date.

Backups older than a specified age are automatically deleted (this feature is active for 30 days by default, but you can remove or configure it via code if you don't want the backups to be deleted).

### Prerequisites
* **Google Drive Account:** You need OAuth2 credentials. **Get** them from the following link: [Link](https://console.cloud.google.com/apis/credentials/oauthclient/)
* **n8n Version:** Recommended **v1.70.1** to **v2.1.4** or higher (required for the modern "Loop Over Items" node).
* **n8n API Key:** **Guide** from the following link: [Link](https://witmovil.com/where-to-create-the-api-key-in-n8n/)
* **Destination Folders:**
* `n8n_old`
* `n8n_backups`
*(Note: If these don't exist, the workflow is designed to create them automatically).*

### Configuration
1. **Credentials:** Update all Google Drive nodes and the "Get many workflows" node with your valid credentials.
2. **Schedule:** Edit the **Schedule Trigger** node with the desired time to run the backup.

**If you want to automatically purge old backups:**

1. **Set Days:** Edit the **"you can delete"** (Code) node to specify the age of the backups you want to delete (default is 30 days).
2. **Activate:** Enable the **"PURGE DAYS"** trigger node and the 3 subsequent nodes.
3. **Run:** Enable the workflow to run on the specified schedule.

## Contact me
**By Mail**: [Send Mail](mailto:nuntius.creative.hub@gmail.com)
**By LinkedIn**: [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/jeyson-orozco/)

### Workflow Logic
* **Schedule Trigger**: Automatically starts the flow at scheduled intervals.
* **GET CURRENT FOLDER**: Retrieves data from the current folder in Google Drive.
* **Code (Verify folders)**: Checks if the folders `n8n_backups` and `n8n_old` exist. If not, triggers their creation.
* **If n8n_backups**: Checks if the `n8n_backups` folder exists. If not, creates it.
* **If n8n_old**: Checks if the `n8n_old` folder exists. If not, creates it.

user.name: Jeyson Orozco

I‚Äôm proficient in multiple platforms, including Linux, Android, Windows, IoT, and data backups. I also have experience in web development, bots, APIs, and process automation. I offer efficient solutions for IT projects and remote user support, with a focus on technological optimization and security.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
